case.source_asf: ASF Cuenta Publica 2020 - Auditorias al sector salud, ASF Informe Especial COVID-19
case.notes: Emergency procurement during COVID-19 pandemic saw widespread irregularities including: overpricing of medical supplies, direct awards without justification, contracts to newly created companies, and delivery failures. ASF identified over 500 observations across health sector. Confidence is medium because investigations are ongoing and some may have legitimate emergency justifications.

patterns.description: Ventilators purchased at 3-5x international market price
Companies created in 2019-2020 winning contracts >100M MXN
Multiple contracts with partial or no delivery
Same vendors receiving multiple direct awards within weeks

caveats: COVID emergency context may justify some direct awards
Ongoing investigations - not all vendors are proven fraudulent
Price benchmarks complicated by global supply chain disruption
Evidence strength varies significantly between cases
